mads:mads.mads:note: His Mimus, 1991: PHI CD ROM #5.3, Latin Canon, bibliographic screen (Lentulus)
Pauly-Wissowa: 24. Halbbd., col. 1946; "Lentulus", #1 (Lentulus; writer of mimes; early imperial period)
Dict. of Greek and Roman biog. and mythology, 1967: v.2, p. 734 (Lentulus; actor and writer of mimes; must have lived before the end of the first century of the Christian era)

Smith's Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology, Vol 2, 1867, p. 734: "Lentulus, an actor in mimes, and also a writer of mimes, which must have been of considerable celebrity, as they are referred to several times by subsequent writers..."

Brill's New Pauly: "Lentulus, 1, mimographer in the early Imperial period, the mimographus L. should be dated to the early Imperial period; he was the author of the lost mime of Catinenses (Tert. De pallio 4,1). Tert. Apol. 15,1 puts L. and the mimographer Hostilius together and attributes to them a series of droll mimes about gods..." Benz, Lore (Kiel). "Lentulus." Brill's New Pauly. Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and Helmuth Schneider . Brill, 2009. Brill Online.
